rules: Rule1: If a Game requires Technology, then the Game is profitable.
Rule2: Under the condition that an Organization develops a Game, if the Organization is funded, then Technology is licensed.
Rule3: Should a Game be in alpha testing, then it enters beta testing.
Rule4: Assuming a Game is in beta testing, an Organization develops the Game.
Rule5: If a Game is in early access, then its release is delayed.
Rule6: Provided an Organization has a marketing campaign, if it is not the case that the Game being released implies it is profitable, then the Game enters early access.
Rule7: An Organization has a marketing campaign or it issues a press release.
Rule8: If an Organization issues a press release, then it releases a demo.
Rule9: Given that an Organization releases a demo, whenever the Game's release does not imply profitability, the Game enters early access.
Rule10: If a Game requires Material, then it is profitable.
Rule11: Provided that a Game is successful, it is profitable.
Rule12: If a Game has high ratings, then it is successful.
Rule13: Under the condition that a Game is popular, it has high ratings.
Rule14: Either a Game is multiplayer or it is singleplayer.
Rule15: If a Game is singleplayer, then it is profitable.
Rule16: Under the condition that a Game has online features, it is profitable.
Rule17: Provided that a Game is esports ready, it has tournament support.
Rule18: A Game is esports ready or it has a ranking system.
Rule19: An Organization uses a Platform or the Game requires Technology or the Game requires Material.
Rule20: Provided that a Game has matchmaking, then if it has a ranking system, a competitive mode leads to multiplayer games having online features.
Rule21: If Technology is proprietary, then it is open source.
Rule22: Under the condition that a Game is crossplatform, if Technology is open source, then it is not outdated.
Rule23: If a Game is released on Steam, then it is crossplatform.
Rule24: A Game is released on Steam or it is released on Epic.
Rule25: If a Game has a console release, then if it is released on Epic, it is crossplatform.
Rule26: Under the condition that a Game has a mobile release, if it is released on Epic, then it is crossplatform.
Rule27: A Game is released on Xbox or it is released on PlayStation.
Rule28: If a Game is released on PlayStation, then it has a mobile release.
Rule29: Provided that a Game has a PC release, it is released on Switch.
Rule30: If an Organization is crowdfunded, then it is not approved.
Rule31: If an Organization is a small team, then it is an indie developer.
Rule32: An Organization is a small team or it is a large studio.
Rule33: Should Material be compatible with a Platform, then the Organization does not use the Platform.

Rule34: Under the condition that a Game has optimized performance, if it uses a licensed engine, then a large studio developing it implies publisher backing or the Game not being profitable leads to crowdfunding.
Rule35: If a Game has advanced graphics, then should it use a custom engine, it has optimized performance.
Rule36: Provided that a Game has refined gameplay, an Organization develops the Game.
Rule37: If a Game is in early development, then it has buggy gameplay.
Rule38: A Game is in early development or it is in late development.
Rule39: Should a Game be in late development, then it enters the polishing phase.
Rule40: Provided that a Game is in the polishing phase, it reaches gold master.
Rule41: Under the condition that an Organization has a partnership with Technology, Technology is licensed.
Rule42: If an Organization has an acquisition offer, then it has a merger proposal.
Rule43: Provided an Organization has an acquisition offer, it does not have a merger proposal.
Rule44: If an Organization has community engagement, then whenever the Game's release does not imply profitability, the Game enters early access.
Rule45: Should Technology be outdated, then Material is not outdated.
Rule46: If a Game is trending, then it is controversial.
Rule47: Provided that a Game is banned in some countries, it is not controversial.
Rule48: A Game is banned in some countries or it is age restricted.
Rule49: A Game is family friendly or, if it is age restricted, then it is not controversial.
Rule50: A Game is award winning or it is critically acclaimed.
Rule51: Provided that a Game is critically acclaimed, it is successful.
Rule52: If a sequel is planned for the Game, then under the condition that it is award winning, it is successful.
Rule53: Should a spin-off be planned for the Game, then the franchise has not ended.
Rule54: Provided that DLC is planned for the Game, it has microtransactions.
Rule55: DLC is planned for the Game or it has an expansion pack.
Rule56: Under the condition that a Game has an expansion pack, it has tournament support or a competitive mode leading to multiplayer games having online features.
Rule57: If Technology is licensed, then the Organization is not approved.
Rule58: Provided that the Game's release does not imply it is profitable, its release is not delayed.
Rule59: If it is not the case that Technology's compatibility with a Platform implies Material's compatibility, then Technology is proprietary.
Rule60: Should the implication that Technology is compatible with a Platform leads to Material being compatible fail, then Technology is outdated.
Rule61: Under the condition that Technology's compatibility with a Platform does not imply Material's compatibility, Material is outdated.
Rule62: Should a Game's release on Xbox not lead to a console release, then it has a PC release.
Rule63: If a Game's release on Xbox does not imply a console release, then it is not released on Switch.
Rule64: Provided that having microtransactions does not imply tournament support or a competitive mode leading to multiplayer games with online features, the Game uses a subscription model.
Rule65: Should the implication from microtransactions to tournament support or competitive mode with multiplayer online features fail, then the Game does not use a subscription model.
Rule66: If mod support does not lead to a ranking system resulting in competitive mode with multiplayer online features, then the Game has workshop integration.
Rule67: Under the condition that mod support does not imply a ranking system with competitive mode and multiplayer online features, the Game does not have workshop integration.
Rule68: Should the negation of the implication from funded Organization to partnership not lead to an investment round, then the Organization has an acquisition offer.
Rule69: Provided that the negation of the implication from gold master to refined gameplay does not result in certification pending, the Game's certification has failed.
Rule70: If the negation of influencer support or community engagement does not lead to viral marketing, then the Organization runs an ad campaign.
Rule71: Under the condition that the Game not being popular does not imply it is not mainstream, it is trending.
Rule72: If a Game is not popular, then it is niche.
Rule73: Provided that a Game is not popular, it is mainstream.
Rule74: If a Game does not have matchmaking, then it has local play.
Rule75: Provided a sequel is not planned for the Game, the franchise has ended.
Rule76: Under the condition that a sequel is not planned, a spin-off is planned.
Rule77: Should a Game not be profitable, then the Organization is funded.
Rule78: Provided that a Game is not profitable, the Organization is approved.
facts: Fact1: A Game is in alpha testing.
Fact2: A Game is released.
Fact3: A Game has a competitive mode.
Fact4: Technology is compatible with a Platform.
Fact5: A Game uses a licensed engine.
Fact6: A Game uses a custom engine.
Fact7: A Game has advanced graphics.
Fact8: A Game has mod support.
Fact9: A Game is not niche.
Fact10: A Game does not have tournament support.
Fact11: A Game does not have local play.
Fact12: An Organization is not publisher backed.
Fact13: An Organization is not an indie developer.
Fact14: A Game does not have buggy gameplay.
Fact15: A Game's certification is not pending.
Fact16: A Game's certification has not failed.
Fact17: An Organization does not have an investment round.
Fact18: An Organization does not have influencer support.
Fact19: An Organization does not use viral marketing.
Fact20: An Organization does not run an ad campaign.
Fact21: A Game is not family friendly.
